thing-type.label: RFTR9605-T Wireless Duplex Receptacle
thing-type.description: Wireless Duplex Receptacle<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gtEaton’s Z-Wave Plus Wireless Receptacle replaces regular receptacles to provide local and remote wireless ON/OFF control of a single outlet. Each receptacle can be manually and remotely controlled by commands sent from your compatible Z-Wave certified controller. </p&gt <p&gtFeatures &amp; Benefits:</p&gt <ul&gt<li&gtRated for up to ½ HP motor loads</li&gt <li&gtProvides Z-Wave control of one outlet leaving the other one for normal use</li&gt <li&gtSafety shutter system prevents insertion of foreign objects into receptacle</li&gt <li&gtCan be associated with up to 5 other devices</li&gt <li&gtBlue LED at center illuminates to indicate ON/OFF status</li&gt <li&gtPatented indicator system alerts if receptacle is not set up in the network</li&gt <li&gtSingle pole and 3-Way control: Use with standard 3-Way switch or Z-Wave Plus Accessory RF9617</li&gt <li&gtNeutral is required for installation</li&gt <li&gtSupports Z-Wave Plus technology including S2 Security certification for advanced encryption &amp; cybersecurity</li&gt <li&gtVoice and app based control when used with compatible Z-Wave controller</li&gt </ul&gt<br /&gt<h2&gtInclusion Information</h2&gt<p&gtTo include this device in a Z-Wave network:</p&gt <ol&gt<li&gtSelect the command on your Z Wave controller for inclusion (Install, Add Device, Add Node, Include Device, etc.).</li&gt <li&gtPress the device ON/OFF button one time to include it in the network.</li&gt <li&gtBased on the controller, the controller may ask you to scan the QR code or manually enter 5 digit code under the QR code to install the device as a secured device. You may find this QR code on the device or included in device packaging.</li&gt <li&gtAfter the Device is added to the network, the blue indicator LED will stop blinking. This indicates the device is installed in the Z-Wave network</li&gt </ol&gt<br /&gt<h2&gtExclusion Information</h2&gt<p&gtTo exclude this device from a Z-Wave network:</p&gt <ol&gt<li&gtSelect the setting on your Z-Wave controller for exclusion (Uninstall, Remove Device, Remove Node, Exclude Device, etc.).</li&gt <li&gtOnce your controller is in exclusion mode, press the device ON/OFF button one time to exclude it from the network. The LED will start blinking.</li&gt </ol&gt
